title: Premier League target Khama Billiat cheats death after being held hostage by six gun-wielding robbers

locations.name: south africa getty images khama billiat

text:
Good Khama Premier League target Khama Billiat cheats death after being held hostage by six gun-wielding robbers 
The former Swansea and Burnley target was unharmed after handing over cash to thieves brandishing AK-47s By Steve Goodman Comments PREMIER League target Khama Billiat has cheated death after being held hostage by six gun-wielding robbers. 
The Zimbabwe international striker – thought to be the highest-paid player in the South African Premiership – has attracted interest from Swansea, Burnley and Newcastle. Getty Images 3 Khama Billiat was lucky to escape with his life after being ambushed at a petrol station 
Currently South Africa’s Footballer of the Year, Mamelodi Sundowns star Billiat helped his unfancied country reach the African Nations Cup finals earlier this year. 
But the 26-year-old underwent a terrifying ordeal when held hostage at a Johannesburg petrol station last week. 
The six thugs, brandishing AK-47 assault rifles, forced the player to withdraw cash from an ATM and stole his wallet and watch before letting him go. 
Sundowns spokesman Thulani Thuswa said: “I spoke to Billiat, and he said he was lucky to escape with his life. Getty Images The Zimbabwean is reported to be the highest-paid player in South Africa Getty Images Khama Billiat was held hostage by thugs brandishing AK-47s Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Tottenham v Everton Related stories ALAN SHEARER Alexis Sanchez should never be left on the bench... I can't understand what Arsene Wenger was doing MARK HALSEY Weekend review: It's time video technology was introduced into football to help refs make the right decision DANNY HIGGINBOTHAM Swans have hatched a cunning new plan, Man United lack goals behind Zlatan and Boro are blunt TOUGH AWAY TRIP Robert Snodgrass reveals West Ham's warm weather break in Dubai was wrecked by weather worse than Scotland BLAZING ROW Alexis Sanchez walked out of Arsenal training just days before Liverpool clash that led to him being axed CAN‘T BOOK HIM Mark Clattenburg ruled out of FA Cup quarter-finals to officiate in Saudi Arabia ahead of permanent move DEADLY DUO Pep Guardiola reveals he will play Sergio Aguero alongside Gabriel Jesus when Man City's Brazilian star is fit NO GUNNERS TALKS Juventus chief Max Allegri denies talk that he will be replacing Arsene Wenger as Arsenal manager 'WE NEED BETTER ATTITUDE' Hector Bellerin admits Arsenal weren't motivated for Liverpool's fast start at Anfield IBROX BURNING? Huge fire breaks out in scrapyard near Ibrox sparking fears Rangers' stadium was set ablaze ALEXITS Alexis Sanchez set for Arsenal summer exit after series of blazing rows with Arsene Wenger led to him being benched at Liverpool CHAT'S AMAZING Jan Vertonghen gives incredible five-second, three-word interview after Tottenham's win over Everton 
"He had gone to buy petrol and prepaid electricity. 
"It is very sad that such crimes occur in our country. We are just happy Khama was not injured." 
Billiat has taken advice from his compatriot, ex-Manchester City, Portsmouth and Blackburn striker Benjani Mwaruwari, about landing a move to England. 
He is not the first footballer to encounter gun violence in the Johannesburg area. 
Former South Africa and Orlando Pirates goalkeeper Senzo Meyiwa, 30, was shot dead in a robbery in 2014.
